poem:
**Electric Reverie**

Mellow thrum of guitars  
in north London air—  
TV on the Radio,  
rolling back the reel of time,  
while shadows of the Yeahs  
dance in tune.  
The crowd, a humming city,  
buzzes with promises,  
as kinetic notes reach out  
to touch the edges  
of our century,  
sparking softly,  
electric yet tender.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "TV on the Radio review – US indie rockers roll back the years TV on the Radio kick off the first night of their sold-out three-day residency in north London with a deceptively mellow thrum – the kinetic sort that holds the promise of electricity. The band were originally a pivotal force at the start of the millennium, nourished by the New York ecosystem that gave birth to groups such as Yeah Yeah Yeahs, the". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
